result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter from ADA Schaller requesting a sooner court date.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/31/2022 - A hearing will be scheduled early next week to address the scheduling of a jury trial.**
Defendant returned copy of summons filed by District Attorney office

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with Target/Witness A/Witness B/Witness C/Witness D listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

1:11 PM Defendant Bridget A Burgett in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul S. Crawford in court for Bridget A Burgett. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Attorney Crawford is entering a request for a speedy trial.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
